title: Indian American women 'unscreened, overlooked' amid breast cancer risk in the US??
summary_full: Indian American women face a growing breast cancer crisis, being overlooked due to cultural norms and data gaps. Rising incidence, particularly in younger women, is linked to lifestyle shifts and dense breast tissue. Lower screening rates mean later diagnoses, highlighting an urgent need for targeted outreach and better data collection to improve outcomes.
